title: allow exp from TFT if you're lvl 30+ only?
body:
I enjoy TFT but I don't like that I don't make progress, about to get lvl 500 today but kinda want to also get exp on all game modes just so I or others are not missing out on exp. I'm not sure if riot can fix selective exp gain like this but if they can,  should they? Honestly its not the biggest wrench in the bucket for exp gain but every bit helps right?
 {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

replies.body: How about no, TFT (Team Fight Tactics) is not League proper (Summoners Rift, All Random All Mid, Rotating Game Mode). And in my honest opinion I would like the full removal and segregation of TFT from the League of Legends launcher. I'm fine with TFT existing, but I'm not fine with it being a part of the same launcher.

TFT will never be separate unless something big happens like a mobile port.

TFT alone has brought in a 35% increase in asian LoL participation. This makes it a perfect window for riot to introduce their core game, 5v5 Summoners Rift to the autochess audience.

And addressing the post, yes, i think post 30 exp is a good thing but it needs to be heavily limited to the point where its ~1/3 to ~1/2 of a norms game, since exp in league is calculated from how long the game went, and did you win or not.  TFT gained level experience should not affect those pre summoner lvl30 because it would allow them to jump straight into regular 5v5 ranked

I believe they've already said that they aren't going to have TFT awarding the usual xp. They want players to feel like they're making progress of some sort, but through different metric(s) introduced at a later time.
